title: Individualised instruction
creator_contributor_role: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre, production company
University of New South Wales, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education - Australia - Curricula

Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Audio-visual education
description: Considers the use of tape-slide combinations as a strategy for teaching large undergraduate classes. Two methods of utilisation are discussed. Considers underlying principles such as feedback and student participation, the practicalities of cost and program construction, and attempts to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of this medium.
